content:
Product attributes define coverages, insured items, and other parts of insurance products and health plans. They correspond to anything that's important to quoting, rating, and writing an insurance policy.

Looking to create a power attribute such as a limit, deductible, copay, coinsurance, or out-of-pocket max? See Create Power Attributes.

Go to the Vlocity Attribute Categories page.
Click the name of the attribute category you want to add attributes to.
On the bottom of the left pane, click + Add New Attribute.
Enter a Name for this attribute.
Enter a Code for this attribute. Make it short but descriptive.
Leave Active checked unless you want this attribute to be inactive.
Leave Filterable checked to let services and templates use this attribute to filter insurance products and health plans for rating and display.

If you deselect this option, this attribute won't be usable to filter plans.
Leave Configurable checked to let users configure the attribute when and where it's time to use it.
Enter a Display Sequence to specify where this attribute will appear in lists of attributes displayed.

To learn how Vlocity uses display sequence numbers for attributes and attribute categories, see Attribute Sequencing.

Each attribute within one attribute category must have a unique Display Sequence number.

Select an Attribute Group Type for this attribute, if this attribute will be used for group insurance products such as health, dental, vision, or group life.

Click Save.

Prevent APEX CPU timeout errors from occurring when you update or delete attributes on a coverage spec that's shared across several products. Add PushAttributeInBatchMode to the Insurance Configuration Setup custom setting and define it as true. See Attribute Updates in Batch Mode.

When you create an attribute, you select whether or not it is filterable.
You add Display Sequence numbers to both attribute categories and attributes. Vlocity uses these sequence numbers to order the display attribute categories and attributes.

Group Types are used for attributes that become part of group insurance products.

Prevent APEX CPU timeout errors from occurring when you update or delete attributes on a coverage spec that's shared across several products. Add PushAttributeInBatchMode to the Insurance Configuration Setup custom setting and define it as true. See Attribute Updates in Batch Mode.
title: Creating Product Attributes in Salesforce
